subject: Re: [junit] And now for something completely different: The Way of Testivus
msgSnippet: ... I should add to clarify my position that I think you re wonderful, I like you and I respect you, but I just dislike quite strongly the way you present
messageBody:
J. B. Rainsberger wrote:

> albsavoia wrote:
>
> > Based on the number of replies and positive emails I received from
> > that blog, I realized that the idea of Testivus (an approach to
> > unit/developer testing less focused on testing dogma and more on
> > testing karma) had struck a nerve and decided to take the idea of
> > Testivus even further and wrote "The Way of Testivus".
>
> I object again, as I have in the past, to the notion that conviction is
> dogma. For example, I find that people who disagree with my convictions
> call me dogmatic, and I find that to be a cop-out on their part. I would
> find it easier to take your ideas seriously if you didn't pose them as
> being against some nonexistent testing dogma.

I should add to clarify my position that I think you're wonderful, I
like you and I respect you, but I just dislike quite strongly the way
you present these ideas. You're naturally free not to care about that,
but I hope you continue to like and respect me, as I think you do.

[More concisely: it wasn't a personal attack, so please don't take it
that way.]
